nks Frank - Elaine

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.





=
http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/ 

=A0However, it's constantly changing=
. The radio I made tonight is very simple, and can significantly simplify c=
onstruction. I used to make the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a co=
mmercial radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 

=A0The MK484 is follwed by a=
 couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the audio up to line levels. =
I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the schematics with MS paint=
, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't=A0the best, but it makes =
them e-mailable. 

=A0Frank-S


On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM, Elaine Coa=
tes <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:




Hi folks, I just joined this group.=
=A0 I was recently at the Lizzy Borden house in Massachusetts with Chris Mo=
on and had a session with Frank's Box.=A0 The results were astounding.=A0 I=
s this the newest schematic for Frank's box?=A0 If so, is there a way to ge=
t a clearer copy of it?=A0 My son said he would build one for me and I have=
 been searching for the schematic.=A0 Can anyone help? - Elaine




_______=

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>=

To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com
Sent: Wednesday, =
May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config. [1 Attach=
ment]



=A0I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm going to =
breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin 12-11, this is=
 the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which feeds pin 1.

=A0=
'case anyone cares. 

=A0F-S
